result.execSummary:
The defendant Sirvonta R Shine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge ad all other costs and surcharges by 03-18-16. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

COURT GRANTS EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sirvonta R Shine

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Elizabeth Longo.
Deputy Court Clerk:  cmt
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.

Return of property hearing on May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
**PER DEF's REQUEST WAS NOTIFIED OF COURT DATE BY PHONE CALL**

ADDRESS INFO for Sirvonta R Shine
Current: 8028 W. Grantosa, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2015)
Prior: 7641 North 60th Street Apt 103, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Defendant Sirvonta R Shine in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve  4 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (4) days - TIME SERVED. 
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 3-18-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered defendant is to pay all costs and surcharges by 3-18-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense.  Court finds that society would not be harmed, and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk jks
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sirvonta R Shine
Current: 7641 North 60th Street Apt 103, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 7641 North 60th Street Apt 103, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Defendant Sirvonta R Shine in court.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.46  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-11-2015 at 1:30pm
